chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jay K Uphoff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Expose Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 10:52am
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Lou Ann Bohn.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State moves to:
Ct. 1 (Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Lease 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 2 (Child Enticement-Expose Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 13 Years TOTAL: 8 years incarceration and 5 years ES.
CONDITIONS OF ES: Register as Sex Offender for 15 years; DNA sample and surcharge; CC; Any sex offender rules as PO sees fit; No contact with victim or females under age 18 unless as approved by PO.
Credit for 561 days of time already served

AMENDED.  No contact with victim(s): V.J.M. or females under age of 18 years old.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Defendant MUST LIVE with father.  Defendant MUST REMAIN IN MARATHON COUNTY unless permission from Court.
